alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 03 at 2:54PM PST until March 05 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT ABOVE 5500 FEET FROM 4 PM FRIDAY TO 10 AM PST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM FRIDAY TO 10 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 8 inches above 5500 feet. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, elevations above 5500 feet, including Cedar Pass on California Highway 299. For the Winter Weather Advisory, all other locations east of Tionesta. * WHEN...From 4 PM Friday to 10 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates may reach 1 inch an hour after 10 pm above 5500 feet on Friday. The probability of snow exceeding 6 inches above 5500 feet is 45% * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property.
